paper_abstract: Tight connections between leaf languages and strings compressed by straight-line programs (SLPs) are established. It is shown that the compressed membership problem for a language L is complete for the leaf language class defined by L via logspace machines. A more difficult variant of the compressed membership problem for L is shown to be complete for the leaf language class defined by L via polynomial time machines. As a corollary, it is shown that there exists a fixed linear visibly pushdown language for which the compressed membership problem is PSPACE-complete. For XML languages, it is shown that the compressed membership problem is coNP-complete. Furthermore it is shown that the embedding problem for SLP-compressed strings is hard for PP (probabilistic polynomial time). (C) 2011 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
